analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de yang med la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de yang med pa'i phyir /
translated: “Because that meditative stabilization does not exist and that bodhisattva great being does not exist,

original: rnam par shes pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med do //
translated: he does not cognize it.

original: 'du shes su 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mchog chen po'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes su 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mchog chen po'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par yin no //
translated: He does not conceptualize it.” This is the special object and aspect of the great supreme mundane quality.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Then the Lord🔽gave his approval to the Venerable Subhūti, saying,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la legs so zhes bya ba gnang ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la legs so zhes bya ba gnang ste /
translated: “Excellent, Subhūti!

original: ji ltar khyod nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa rnams kyi mchog tu bstan pa ltar ston pa ni legs so //
analyzed: ji ltar khyod nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa rnams kyi mchog tu bstan pa ltar ston pa ni legs so //
translated: It is excellent, Subhūti, that you teach the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings in such a way that you teach it as the foremost of those without afflictions.

original: legs so // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
analyzed: legs so // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: should train in the perfection of wisdom in that way.

original: de ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: They should train in the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity in that way.

original: de ltar byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la bslab par bya'o //
translated: They should train in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha in that way.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
translated: Then venerable Śāriputra🔽said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: “Excellent, excellent, Subhūti!

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa lags sam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa lags sam /
translated: “Blessed One, do bodhisattva great beings who train like that train in the perfection of wisdom?

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa lags sam /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa lags sam /
translated: Do they train in the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity?

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la slob pa lags sam /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la slob pa lags sam /
translated: Do they train in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob pa ni /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob pa ni /
translated: “Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings who train like that

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul @156b gyis slob pa yin /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul @156b gyis slob pa yin /
translated: train in the perfection of wisdom by way of not apprehending anything.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin /
translated: They train in the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of moral discipline, and the perfection of generosity, without apprehending anything.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin no //
translated: They train in the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, the meditative concentrations, the immeasurable aspirations, the formless meditative absorptions, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, without apprehending anything.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: “Lord, it is amazing how deeply these bodhisattva great beings have entered into this perfection of wisdom, in that they do not tremble, feel frightened, or become terrified when they hear this exposition of the perfection of wisdom.”

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa lags sam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa lags sam /
translated: “Blessed One, do bodhisattva great beings who train in the perfection of wisdom like that train in the manner of not apprehending anything?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin no //
translated: “Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings who train in the perfection of wisdom like that train in the manner of not apprehending anything.”

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du mi dmigs pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du mi dmigs pa lags /
translated: “Blessed One, why is it not apprehended?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: sh'a ri'i bu shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir bdag mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir bdag mi dmigs so //
translated: “Śāriputra, a self is not apprehended because it is utterly pure.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / tshor pa po dang / shes pa po dang /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / tshor pa po dang / shes pa po dang /
translated: A being, a living being, a creature, a person, a human, a human being, one who does, one who feels, one who knows, and one who sees are not apprehended because they are utterly pure.

original: mthong ba po mi dmigs so //🔽shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mthong ba po mi dmigs so // shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal mi dmigs so //
translated: The seer is not apprehended.🔽Suffering is not apprehended.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mi dmigs so //🔽shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mi dmigs so // shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
translated: The origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path are not apprehended.

original: 'dod pa'i khams mi dmigs so //🔽shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams mi dmigs so // shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
translated: The desire realm is not apprehended.

original: gzugs kyi khams mi dmigs so //🔽shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams mi dmigs so // shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
translated: The form realm is not apprehended.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams mi dmigs so //🔽shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams mi dmigs so // shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
translated: The formless realm is not apprehended.

original: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi dmigs so //🔽shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi dmigs so // shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
translated: The meditative concentrations, the immeasurable aspirations, and the formless absorptions are not apprehended.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / @157a * //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / @157a * //
translated: The applications of mindfulness, the correct exertions, the supports for miraculous ability, the faculties,

original: stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam mi dmigs so //
analyzed: stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam mi dmigs so //
translated: the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the path are not apprehended.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /🔽pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mi dmigs so //
translated: The perfections are non-apprehensible because of their utter purity.🔽The ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are non-apprehensible because of their utter purity.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
translated: The thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are non-apprehensible because of their utter purity.🔽The ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are non-apprehensible because of their utter purity.🔽The emptinesses are non-apprehensible because of their utter purity.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu mi dmigs so //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu mi dmigs so //
translated: The doors to liberation are non-apprehensible because of their utter purity.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams mi dmigs so //
translated: The applications of mindfulness are non-apprehensible because of their utter purity.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /🔽rgyun tu zhugs pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir / rgyun tu zhugs pa mi dmigs so //
translated: The right efforts are non-apprehensible because of their utter purity.🔽The legs of miraculous power are non-apprehensible because of their utter purity.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /🔽lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas mi dmigs so //
translated: The faculties are non-apprehensible because of their utter purity.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /🔽byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir / byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs so //
translated: The powers are non-apprehensible because of their utter purity.🔽The limbs of awakening are non-apprehensible because of their utter purity.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /🔽byang chub mi dmigs so //🔽shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir / byang chub mi dmigs so // shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
translated: The path is non-apprehensible because of its utter purity.🔽The ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are non-apprehensible because of their utter purity.🔽The ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are non-apprehensible because of their utter purity.🔽The ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are non-apprehensible because of their utter purity.🔽The ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are non-apprehensible because of their utter purity.

original: sangs rgyas mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mi dmigs so //
translated: The ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are non-apprehensible because of their utter purity.🔽The ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa gang lags /
translated: He asked, “Bhagavān, what is pure?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa 'di ni rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa 'di ni rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: “Śāriputra, the non-arising of all phenomena, their non-occurrence, their non-apprehension, and their non-conditioning are called ‘pure.’

original: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar na /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar na /
translated: Śāriputra, in that way

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa spyi'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa spyi'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: bodhisattva great beings train in all phenomena by way of non-apprehension.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gang dang gang la slob pa lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gang dang gang la slob pa lags /
translated: He asked, “Bhagavān, in what phenomena do bodhisattva great beings who train in that way train?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied,🔽“Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings who train in that way train in the perfection of giving.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos gang la yang slob pa med do //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos gang la yang slob pa med do //
translated: Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings training like that do not train in any dharma at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu chos 'di dag ni /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu chos 'di dag ni /
translated: Śāriputra, these dharmas

original: byis pa so so'i skye bos ji ltar mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bos ji ltar mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: do not exist in the way that foolish, ordinary beings are attached to them.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'o na chos 'di dag rnam pa ji ltar mchis pa lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'o na chos 'di dag rnam pa ji ltar mchis pa lags /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Well then, Blessed One, how do these dharmas exist?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: ji ltar mid pa de ltar yod de /
analyzed: ji ltar mid pa de ltar yod de /
translated: “They exist in the way they are imagined.🔽Because they do not exist in that way, they are said not to exist.”

original: de ltar yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir med ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni drod du gtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa'i dang po ma rig pa'i rtog pa @157b yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir med ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni drod du gtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa'i dang po ma rig pa'i rtog pa @157b yin no //
translated: This is the first imagination of the unreal that is associated with the conception of heat.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du mchis pa ma lags pas ma mchis pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du mchis pa ma lags pas ma mchis pa zhes bgyi /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Blessed One, why are they said not to exist because they do not exist?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“

original: sh'a ri'i bu gzugs nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir yod pa ma yin no //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gzugs nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir yod pa ma yin no // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Śāriputra, it is because form is not existent due to inner emptiness, up to it is not existent due to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.🔽It is because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not existent due to inner emptiness, up to they are not existent due to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi bar du nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir yod pa ma yin no//
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi bar du nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir yod pa ma yin no//
translated: Up to it is because the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are not existent due to inner emptiness, up to they are not existent due to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa gnyis pa gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa gnyis pa gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la rtog pa yin no //
translated: up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not existent because of inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature. This is the second concept in that [chapter] that is a concept about the aggregates such as form.

original: de la byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni ma rig pa dang / sred pa la mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: de la byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni ma rig pa dang / sred pa la mngon par zhen to //
translated: In this regard, foolish ordinary beings are attached to ignorance and craving.

original: de dag gis ni ma rig pa dang / sred pas brtags so //
analyzed: de dag gis ni ma rig pa dang / sred pas brtags so //
translated: They are imputed by those two, ignorance and craving.

original: brtags nas ma rig pa dang / sred pa dag gis mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: brtags nas ma rig pa dang / sred pa dag gis mngon par zhen te /
translated: Having been imputed, they are attached to ignorance and craving.

original: mtha' gnyis su chags pas de dag gis mtha' gnyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis su chags pas de dag gis mtha' gnyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: Because of attachment to the two extremes, they do not know and do not see the two extremes as they really are.

original: de dag gis ji lta ba bzhin med pa'i chos de dag brtags nas ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa nas /
analyzed: de dag gis ji lta ba bzhin med pa'i chos de dag brtags nas ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa nas /
translated: Having imputed those phenomena that do not exist as they are imputed, they are attached to name and form,🔽up to

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar la mngon par zhen par gyur to zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa gsum pa ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa'i rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar la mngon par zhen par gyur to zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa gsum pa ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa'i rtog pa yin no //
translated: This is the third conception of the bodhisattva, the conception of the attachment to name-and-form.

original: chos rnams la mngon par zhen pa de dag ni med pa'i mtha' gnyis dag tu rtog par byed /
analyzed: chos rnams la mngon par zhen pa de dag ni med pa'i mtha' gnyis dag tu rtog par byed /
translated: Those who are attached to phenomena conceive of the two extremes of existence and non-existence.

original: brtags nas mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: brtags nas mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: Having conceived, they do not know or see.

original: ci zhig mi shes mi mthong zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig mi shes mi mthong zhe na /
translated: What do they not know or see?

original: gzugs mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not know or see form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi shes mi mthong ba nas /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi shes mi mthong ba nas /
translated: They do not know or see feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness,

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i bar du mi shes mi mthong ngo //🔽byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun mi shes mi mthong ba nas /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i bar du mi shes mi mthong ngo // byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun mi shes mi mthong ba nas /
translated: up to they do not know or see the sense domains, elements, or dependent origination.🔽They do not know or see the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du mi shes mi mthong ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du mi shes mi mthong ste /
translated: up to they do not know or see the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de ltar de dag ni byis pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa bzhi pa mtha' gnyis la chags @158a * //🔽pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni byis pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa bzhi pa mtha' gnyis la chags @158a * // pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: This is the fourth conception of those who are attached to the two extremes.

original: de dag ni ma rig pa dang / sred pa'i rkyen gyis mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni ma rig pa dang / sred pa'i rkyen gyis mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not know and do not see due to the condition of ignorance and craving.

original: ci zhig mi shes mi mthong zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig mi shes mi mthong zhe na /
translated: What do they not know and not see?

original: gzugs kun nas nyon mongs pa'o zhes mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kun nas nyon mongs pa'o zhes mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not know and do not see that form is afflicted.

original: de bzhin du gzugs rnam par byang ba'o zhes mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs rnam par byang ba'o zhes mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: Similarly, they do not know and do not see that form is purified.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'o zhes mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'o zhes mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not know and do not see that feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are afflicted.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa rnam par byang ba'o zhes mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa rnam par byang ba'o zhes mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: Similarly, they do not know and do not see that consciousness is purified.

original: de dag ni nges par mi 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni nges par mi 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not attain definite emergence.

original: gang nas nges par mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: gang nas nges par mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: From what will they not attain definite emergence?

original: 'dod pa'i khams nas nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽gzugs kyi khams nas nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams nas nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro // gzugs kyi khams nas nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not escape from the desire realm.🔽They will not escape from the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams nas nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams nas nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not escape from the formless realm.🔽They will not escape from the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha dharmas.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos dag las nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa lnga pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos dag las nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa lnga pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: This is the fifth conception of that one, the conception that does not understand complete affliction and purification.

original: de dag ni mi dad do //
analyzed: de dag ni mi dad do //
translated: They do not have faith.

original: ji ltar mi dad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi dad ce na /
translated: How do they not have faith?

original: gzugs gzugs kyis stong zhes bya bar mi dad do //
analyzed: gzugs gzugs kyis stong zhes bya bar mi dad do //
translated: They do not have faith that form is empty of form.

original: byang chub kyi bar du byang chub kyis stong zhes bya bar mi dad do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du byang chub kyis stong zhes bya bar mi dad do //
translated: They do not have faith that awakening is empty of awakening.

original: de dag ni gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not abide.

original: ji ltar gnas pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How do they not abide?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ma yin /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ma yin /
translated: They do not abide in the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ma yin /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ma yin /
translated: They do not stand in the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, or the perfection of meditation.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ma yin /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ma yin /
translated: They do not stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa ma yin /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa ma yin /
translated: They do not stand in the irreversible stage.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not stand in the eighteen special qualities of a Buddha.

original: de dag ni mngon par zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni mngon par zhen pa yin no //
translated: They are attached.

original: ji ltar mngon par zhen pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par zhen pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are they attached?

original: gzugs la mngon par zhen pa yin /
analyzed: gzugs la mngon par zhen pa yin /
translated: They are attached to form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mngon par zhen pa yin /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mngon par zhen pa yin /
translated: They are attached to feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

original: mig la mngon par zhen pa yin /
analyzed: mig la mngon par zhen pa yin /
translated: They are attached to the eyes.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la mngon par zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la mngon par zhen pa yin no //
translated: They are attached to the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mngon par zhen pa yin /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mngon par zhen pa yin /
translated: They are attached to the sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / @158b gti mug la mngon par zhen pa yin /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / @158b gti mug la mngon par zhen pa yin /
translated: They are attached to desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: lta bar gyur pa rnams la mngon par zhen pa yin /
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa rnams la mngon par zhen pa yin /
translated: They are attached to the views.

original: byang chub kyi bar la mngon par zhen pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar la mngon par zhen pa yin te /
translated: They are attached to awakening.

original: de'i phyir na byis pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na byis pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called childish.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ba lags sam /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ba lags sam / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Śāriputra then asked, “Blessed One, do bodhisattva great beings who train in this way not train in the perfection of wisdom and not emerge into complete knowing?”

original: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob pa yin /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob pa yin /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings who train in this way do not train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ba yin no //
translated: They do not emerge into complete knowing.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: He asked, “Bhagavān, why is it so?

original: byang chub sems dpa' de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob pa lags /
translated: Why are bodhisattvas not training in the perfection of wisdom?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ba lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ba lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Why are they not attaining the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mi mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rtog par byed /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mi mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rtog par byed /
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Śāriputra, here bodhisattva great beings, unskilled in means, imagine the perfection of wisdom,

original: mngon par zhen par byed /
analyzed: mngon par zhen par byed /
translated: and they settle down on it.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rtog par byed /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rtog par byed /
translated: They imagine the perfection of concentration,

original: mngon par zhen par byed /
analyzed: mngon par zhen par byed /
translated: and they settle down on it.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rtog par byed /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rtog par byed /
translated: They imagine the perfection of perseverance,

original: mngon par zhen par byed /
analyzed: mngon par zhen par byed /
translated: and they settle down on it.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rtog par byed /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rtog par byed /
translated: They imagine the perfection of patience,

original: mngon par zhen par byed /
analyzed: mngon par zhen par byed /
translated: and they settle down on it.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rtog par byed /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rtog par byed /
translated: They imagine the perfection of morality,

original: mngon par zhen par byed /
analyzed: mngon par zhen par byed /
translated: and they settle down on it.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rtog par byed /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rtog par byed /
translated: They form mental constructs about the transcendent perfection of generosity,🔽and they form mental constructs about the transcendent perfection of ethical discipline,

original: mngon par zhen par byed /
analyzed: mngon par zhen par byed /
translated: the transcendent perfection of tolerance,🔽the transcendent perfection of perseverance,🔽the transcendent perfection of meditative concentration,🔽and the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la rtog par byed /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la rtog par byed /
translated: They form mental constructs about the applications of mindfulness,

original: mngon par zhen par byed /
analyzed: mngon par zhen par byed /
translated: the correct exertions,🔽the supports for miraculous ability,🔽the faculties,🔽the powers,🔽the branches of enlightenment,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam la rtog par byed /🔽mngon par zhen par byed /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam la rtog par byed / mngon par zhen par byed /
translated: and the path.🔽They form mental constructs about the ten powers of the tathāgatas,🔽the four assurances,🔽the four kinds of exact knowledge,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la rtog par byed /🔽mngon par zhen par byed pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la rtog par byed / mngon par zhen par byed pa nas /
translated: and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.🔽They form mental constructs about all phenomena,

original: chos thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la rtog par byed /
analyzed: chos thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la rtog par byed /
translated: up to and including omniscience.

original: mngon par zhen par byed @159a * //
analyzed: mngon par zhen par byed @159a * //
translated: They are attached to them.

original: do // sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: do // sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na /
translated: Śāriputra, for these reasons

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob pa yin /
translated: bodhisattva great beings do not train in the perfection of wisdom,🔽and do not emerge into the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa drug pa 'phags pa'i lam la mi gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar bslabs pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa drug pa 'phags pa'i lam la mi gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar bslabs pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ji lta bu lags /
translated: This is the sixth conception, the conception that they do not stand in the noble path.🔽Śāriputra said, “Lord, how do bodhisattva great beings train in the perfection of wisdom so that they will emerge into the knowledge of all aspects?”🔽The Lord said,🔽“Śāriputra, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not stand in form, do not stand in feeling, do not stand in perception, do not stand in volitional factors, do not stand in consciousness;

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: do not stand in the constituents, do not stand in the sense fields, do not stand in the perfections, do not stand in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, do not stand in the ten powers, do not stand in the four fearlessnesses, do not stand in the four detailed and thorough knowledges, do not stand in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, do not stand in the knowledge of all aspects, do not stand in the knowledge of paths, do not stand in the knowledge of all bases, do not stand in the knowledge of all kinds of existents, do not stand in the knowledge of the varieties of those, do not stand in the knowledge of the thoughts of others, do not stand in the knowledge of the exhaustion of the outflows, do not stand in the fruit of entering the stream, do not stand in the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, do not stand in the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, do not stand in arhatship, do not stand in individual enlightenment, do not stand in the knowledge of all aspects, do not stand in the knowledge of paths, do not stand in the knowledge of all bases, do not stand in the knowledge of all kinds of existents, do not stand in the knowledge of the varieties of those, do not stand in the knowledge of the thoughts of others, do not stand in the knowledge of the exhaustion of the outflows, do not stand in the fruit of entering the stream, do not stand in the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, do not stand in the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, do not stand in arhatship, do not stand in individual enlightenment, do not stand in the knowledge of all aspects, do not stand

original: sh'a ri'i bu nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de ltar slob na /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de ltar slob na /
translated: “Śāriputra, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that do not apprehend that perfection of wisdom and do not see it, they train like that.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings will go forth to the knowledge of all aspects by way of not apprehending anything.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Similarly, they do not apprehend the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, the perfection of giving,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar mi dmigs /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar mi dmigs /
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bde ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob na /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bde ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob na /
translated: In the same way, Śāriputra, when bodhisattva great beings train in the perfection of wisdom,

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they will go forth to the knowledge of all aspects by way of not apprehending anything.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ni /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ni /
translated: “Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that,🔽training in the perfection of wisdom like that, will go forth to the knowledge of all aspects by way of not apprehending anything.”

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa bdun pa dmigs pa la rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa bdun pa dmigs pa la rtog pa yin no //
translated: This is the seventh conception, the conception of an objective support, in that chapter.

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra then said,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byang ba lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byang ba lags /
translated: “Lord, how do they go forth to the knowledge of all aspects by way of not apprehending anything?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not apprehend a form that is past, future, or present.

original: sh'a ri'i bu shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir bdag mi dmigs shing mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir bdag mi dmigs shing mi mthong ngo //
translated: Śāriputra, because of complete purity, the self is not apprehended and is not seen.

original: de bzhin du shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, because of complete purity,🔽up to the knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended and is not seen.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs shing mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba de nyid kyi rtog pa @159b brgyad pa bdag la sogs par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs shing mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba de nyid kyi rtog pa @159b brgyad pa bdag la sogs par rtog pa yin no //
translated: This is the ninth conception, the conception of purity.🔽Śāriputra, purity is non-arising, non-occurrence, and non-conditioning.

original: sh'a ri'i bu rnam par dag pa ni skye ba med pa ma byung ba mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa dgu pa rnam par dag pa skye ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu rnam par dag pa ni skye ba med pa ma byung ba mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa dgu pa rnam par dag pa skye ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: This is the tenth conception, the conception of purity as non-arising, etc.

original: 'di dag ni gzung ba'i rtog pa dang po yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni gzung ba'i rtog pa dang po yin no //
translated: These are the first conceptions of the apprehended.

original: de thabs mi mkhas pas gzugs la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin /
analyzed: de thabs mi mkhas pas gzugs la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin /
translated: He, unskilled in means, conceives of form and becomes attached to it.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rtse mor gtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa dang po phung po'i don la rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rtse mor gtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa dang po phung po'i don la rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: up to and including consciousness. This is the first form of discursive thought, which is associated with the peak of existence and is concerned with the meaning of the aggregates.

original: mig la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin /🔽de bzhin du yid kyi bar dang gzugs la mngon par rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin /
analyzed: mig la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin / de bzhin du yid kyi bar dang gzugs la mngon par rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin /
translated: One discursively thinks and becomes notionally attached to the idea that the eye exists.🔽Similarly, one discursively thinks and becomes notionally attached to the idea that the mental faculty exists, up to and including the idea that mental phenomena exist.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi bar la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa gnyis pa skye ba'i sgo'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi bar la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa gnyis pa skye ba'i sgo'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: This is the second form of discursive thought, which is concerned with the meaning of the sense-fields that are the doors of entry.

original: mig dang gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams su rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams su rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin /
translated: One discursively thinks and becomes notionally attached to the idea that the eye, visible form and the eye-consciousness element exist.

original: de bzhin du yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa gsum pa rigs kyi don la rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa gsum pa rigs kyi don la rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, he conceives of and becomes fixated on the mental faculty, mental objects, and the mental consciousness element. This is the third conception in that context, the conception of the meaning of the family.

original: ma rig par rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin /
analyzed: ma rig par rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin /
translated: He conceives of and becomes fixated on ignorance.

original: de bzhin du rga shir rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar du'o zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa bzhi pa skye ba'i don la rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rga shir rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar du'o zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa bzhi pa skye ba'i don la rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, he conceives of and becomes fixated on aging and death. This is the fourth conception in that context, the conception of the meaning of origination.

original: de nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa lnga pa stong pa nyid kyi don la rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: de nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa lnga pa stong pa nyid kyi don la rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: He conceives of and becomes fixated on the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, and the emptiness of emptiness, up to and including the emptiness that is the nonapprehension of any defining characteristics. This is the fifth conception in that context, the conception of the meaning of emptiness.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa drug pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i don la rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa drug pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i don la rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: He conceptualizes and becomes fixated on the six perfections. This is the sixth conceptualization in the context of the meaning of the perfections.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He conceptualizes and becomes fixated on the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: de nyid kyi rtog pa bdun pa mthong pa'i lam la rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rtog pa bdun pa mthong pa'i lam la rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: This is the seventh conceptualization in the context of the path of seeing.

original: de bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la rtog cing /
analyzed: de bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la rtog cing /
translated: He conceptualizes and becomes fixated on the meditative stabilizations, the superknowledges, the immeasurables, and the formless meditative stabilizations.

original: ma 'ong par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma 'ong par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He conceptualizes and becomes fixated on the future.

original: de nyid kyi rtog pa brgyad pa bsgom pa'i lam la rnam par rtog pa yin no //🔽de bzhin gshegs @160a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rtog pa brgyad pa bsgom pa'i lam la rnam par rtog pa yin no // de bzhin gshegs @160a * //
translated: This is the eighth conceptualization in the context of the path of cultivation.

original: pa'i stobs bcur rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin /
analyzed: pa'i stobs bcur rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin /
translated: He conceptualizes and becomes fixated on the ten powers of the tathāgatas.🔽 He conceptualizes and becomes fixated on the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽 He conceptualizes and becomes fixated on the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa dgu pa mi slob pa'i lam la rtog pa yin no //🔽'di dag ni gzung ba'i rtog pa gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa dgu pa mi slob pa'i lam la rtog pa yin no // 'di dag ni gzung ba'i rtog pa gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought, and the thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought.

original: sh'a ri'i bu bdag nye bar mi dmigs /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu bdag nye bar mi dmigs /
translated: The thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought, and the thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought.🔽The thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought, and the thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought.🔽The thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought, and the thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought.🔽The thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought, and the thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought.

original: de bzhin du sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / rig pa po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po mi dmigs so //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / rig pa po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po mi dmigs so // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought, and the thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought.🔽The thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought, and the thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought.🔽The thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought, and the thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought.🔽The thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought, and the thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir bdag med cing mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni bzod par gtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa las /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir bdag med cing mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni bzod par gtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa las /
translated: The thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought, and the thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought.🔽The thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought, and the thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought.

original: rtog pa dang po bdag rang dbang can la rnam par rtog pa'o //🔽sh'a ri'i bu gzugs nye bar mi dmigs zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rtog pa dang po bdag rang dbang can la rnam par rtog pa'o //🔽sh'a ri'i bu gzugs nye bar mi dmigs zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The thought I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is a thought,

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar du nye bar mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa gnyis pa bdag gcig pur rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar du nye bar mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa gnyis pa bdag gcig pur rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: Up to the non-apprehension of consciousness is the second conception of that, the conception of a single self.

original: sh'a ri'i bu mig mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu mig mi dmigs so //
translated: Śāriputra, the eye is not apprehended.

original: de bzhin du yid kyi bar dang / gzugs mi dmigs /
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi bar dang / gzugs mi dmigs /
translated: Up to the mind is not apprehended. Form is not apprehended.

original: chos kyi bar du mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa gsum pa rgyu'i bdag nyid la rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi bar du mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa gsum pa rgyu'i bdag nyid la rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: Up to dharmas are not apprehended is the third conception of that, the conception of the nature of a cause.

original: sh'a ri'i bu mig dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu mig dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa mi dmigs so //
translated: Śāriputra, the eye, form, and eye consciousness are not apprehended.

original: yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa bzhi pa lta ba po la sogs pa'i bdag tu rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa bzhi pa lta ba po la sogs pa'i bdag tu rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: Up to the mind, dharmas, and mind consciousness are not apprehended is the fourth conception of that, the conception of a self that is a seer, etc.

original: sh'a ri'i bu rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mi dmigs so //
translated: Śāriputra, dependent origination is not apprehended.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bar du mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa lnga pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rten gyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bar du mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa lnga pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rten gyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: up to the formless realm is not apprehended. This is the fifth conception in that context, the conception of a self as the basis of affliction.

original: bsam gtan dang po mi dmigs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po mi dmigs so //
translated: The first concentration is not apprehended.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar du mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa drug pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rten gyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar du mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa drug pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rten gyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: up to the formless absorptions are not apprehended. This is the sixth conception in that context, the conception of a self as the basis of freedom from attachment.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa bdun pa mthong ba'i rten gyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa bdun pa mthong ba'i rten gyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: The noble truths are not apprehended. This is the seventh conception in that context, the conception of a self as the basis of seeing.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni de @160b nyid kyi rtog pa brgyad pa sgom pa'i rten gyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni de @160b nyid kyi rtog pa brgyad pa sgom pa'i rten gyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: The eight liberations and the nine serial absorptions are not apprehended. This is the eighth conception in that context, the conception of a self as the basis of meditation.

original: stobs bcu mi dmigs so //
analyzed: stobs bcu mi dmigs so //
translated: The ten powers are non-apprehensible.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs so //
translated: Up to the knowledge of all aspects is non-apprehensible.

original: ji ltar mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi dmigs she na /
translated: In what way are they non-apprehensible?

original: bdag nyid du'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid du'o //
translated: In their very essence.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?🔽Because the self is utterly pure.

original: bdag shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa dgu pa don byas pa'i rten gyi rnam par rtog pa yin no 'di dag ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po yin no //🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: bdag shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa dgu pa don byas pa'i rten gyi rnam par rtog pa yin no 'di dag ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po yin no // de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: This is the ninth conception, the conception of the basis of the fulfilled aim, in the same chapter.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das la la zhig 'di skad du 'dri zhing ci sgyu ma'i skyes bu 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la la zhig 'di skad du 'dri zhing ci sgyu ma'i skyes bu 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: “Blessed One, if someone were to ask, ‘Does this illusory person train in the perfection of wisdom🔽and emerge in the knowledge of all aspects?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram zhes mchi na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram zhes mchi na /
translated: Does he attain the knowledge of all aspects?’

original: bcom ldan 'das de skad du 'dri ba de la ji skad du bstan par bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de skad du 'dri ba de la ji skad du bstan par bgyi /
translated: Blessed One, how should I explain to him what he has asked?”

original: ci sgyu ma'i skyes bu 'di bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /
analyzed: ci sgyu ma'i skyes bu 'di bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /
translated: “Should this illusory person train in the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of discipline, and the perfection of generosity,🔽and then emerge in the knowledge of all aspects?🔽Should this illusory person train in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: and then emerge in the knowledge of all aspects?

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu 'di byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi bar la bslabs shing /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu 'di byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi bar la bslabs shing /
translated: Should this illusory person train in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽and then emerge in the knowledge of all aspects?”🔽“Subhūti, this illusory person does not train in the perfection of generosity,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: and then emerge in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti, this illusory person does not train in the perfection of discipline,🔽and then emerge in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti, this illusory person does not train in the perfection of patience,🔽and then emerge in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti, this illusory person does not train in the perfection of perseverance,🔽and then emerge in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti, this illusory person does not train in the perfection of concentration,🔽and then emerge in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti, this illusory person does not train in the perfection of wisdom,🔽and then emerge in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti, this illusory person does not train in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,🔽and then emerge in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti, this illusory person does not train in the ten powers of a tathāgata,🔽and then emerge in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti, this illusory person does not train in the four fearlessnesses,🔽and then emerge in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti, this illusory person does not train in the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽and then emerge in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la bslabs shing /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la bslabs shing /
translated: Subhūti, this illusory person does not train in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽and then emerge in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti, this illusory person does not train in the knowledge of all aspects,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: and then emerge in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti, this illusory person does not train in the knowledge of path aspects,🔽and then emerge in the knowledge

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram zhes mchi na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram zhes mchi na /
translated: Will they attain the knowledge of all aspects?

original: bcom ldan 'das de skad du 'dri ba de la ji skad du bstan par bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de skad du 'dri ba de la ji skad du bstan par bgyi /
translated: Blessed One, how should I explain to one who asks this?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor de lta bas na de khyod nyid la dris /
analyzed: rab 'byor de lta bas na de khyod nyid la dris /
translated: Subhūti, therefore, I will ask you about this very matter,🔽and you should answer to the best of your ability.

original: khyod kyis ji ltar bzod pa de ltar lung ston cig / ces bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i rtog pa gnyis pa phyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyis ji ltar bzod pa de ltar lung ston cig / ces bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i rtog pa gnyis pa phyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the second reversal of the conception of grasping.

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /🔽gzugs kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems / gzugs kyang gzhan la /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: Is form one thing and illusion another?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: Is feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness one thing and illusion another?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de lta ma lags so @161a * //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de lta ma lags so @161a * //
translated: He replied, Blessed One, it is not so.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mchog tu gtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa rtog pa dang po yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mchog tu gtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa rtog pa dang po yin no //
translated: This is the first conception belonging to the supreme worldly dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: What do you think, Subhuti,

original: mig kyang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: mig kyang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: are the eye and the magical creation different things?

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /🔽gzugs kyang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam / gzugs kyang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: Are the ear, nose, tongue, body and mind and the magical creation different things?

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos kyang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos kyang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: Are form, sound, smell, taste, touch and dharmas and the magical creation different things?

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhuti replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa gnyis pa skye mched du btags pa la rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rtog pa gnyis pa skye mched du btags pa la rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: No, Lord. This is the second concept that arises in regard to the designation of the sense-fields.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: What do you think, Subhuti,

original: mig dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa yang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: mig dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa yang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that the eye, form, and eye consciousness are one thing, and an illusion another?

original: rna ba dang / sgra dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna dang / dri dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce dang / ro dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus dang / reg bya dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sgra dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna dang / dri dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce dang / ro dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus dang / reg bya dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang /
translated: Do you think that the ear, sound, and ear consciousness are one thing, and an illusion another? Do you think that the nose, smell, and nose consciousness are one thing, and an illusion another? Do you think that the tongue, taste, and tongue consciousness are one thing, and an illusion another? Do you think that the body, tactility, and body consciousness are one thing, and an illusion another?

original: yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that the mind, mental phenomena, and mind consciousness are one thing, and an illusion another?

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: “No, Bhagavan.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa yang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa yang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that the contact that arises from the combination of the eye, form, and eye consciousness is one thing, and an illusion another?

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa yang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa yang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: Is the sensory domain of the ear, the sensory domain of the nose, the sensory domain of the tongue, the sensory domain of the body, and the sensory domain of the mind one thing, and an illusion another?

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: “No, Blessed One.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: Is the feeling that arises from the condition of the sensory domain of the eye, the sensory domain of the eye, and an illusion another?

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te rig pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis @161b tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te rig pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis @161b tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: Is the causal condition of thinking-mind contact a feeling, and is illusion something else?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: Subhūti replied, “No, Blessed One.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: sa'i khams kyang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: sa'i khams kyang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: Is the earth element one thing and illusion another?
