original: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya ste /
translated: “Subhūti, you should know that this is a bodhisattva great being’s spiritual friend.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen des yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstan pa thos nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen des yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstan pa thos nas /
translated: The bodhisattva great being who is assisted by that spiritual friend, when this perfection of wisdom is being taught,

original: mi dngang / kun tu mi skrag / kun tu skrag pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dngang / kun tu mi skrag / kun tu skrag pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: will not tremble, feel frightened, or become terrified.”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti then said,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la skyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la skyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Blessed One, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos nas dngang zhing kun tu skrag la kun tu skrag pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba thabs mi mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu song bar 'gyur ba ji lta bu zhig lags /
analyzed: gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos nas dngang zhing kun tu skrag la kun tu skrag pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba thabs mi mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu song bar 'gyur ba ji lta bu zhig lags /
translated: and will fall into the hands of bad friends?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom zhing dmigs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom zhing dmigs te /
translated: “Subhūti, here, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,🔽they cultivate and objectify the perfection of wisdom with attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa des kyang rlom sems su byed pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral bas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom zhing dmigs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa des kyang rlom sems su byed pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral bas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom zhing dmigs te /
translated: They also falsely project the perfection of wisdom, and they cultivate and objectify the perfection of concentration with attention not connected with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa des kyang rlom sems su byed pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral bas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom zhing dmigs te /🔽brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa des kyang rlom sems su byed pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral bas bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgom zhing dmigs te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa des kyang rlom sems su byed pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral bas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom zhing dmigs te / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa des kyang rlom sems su byed pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral bas bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgom zhing dmigs te /
translated: They cultivate and objectify the perfection of perseverance, but they do so without the attention directed toward omniscience, and they are conceited because of that perfection of perseverance.🔽They cultivate and objectify the perfection of patience, but they do so without the attention directed toward omniscience, and they are conceited because of that perfection of patience.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa des kyang rlom sems su byed pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral bas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom zhing dmigs te /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa des kyang rlom sems su byed pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral bas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom zhing dmigs te /
translated: They cultivate and objectify the perfection of morality, but they do so without the attention directed toward omniscience, and they are conceited because of that perfection of morality.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa des kyang rlom sems su byed pa dang / rnam pa thams cad @170b mkhyen pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral bas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgom zhing dmigs te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa des kyang rlom sems su byed pa dang / rnam pa thams cad @170b mkhyen pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral bas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgom zhing dmigs te /
translated: and through that perfection of morality they become conceited, and they cultivate and focus on the perfection of giving, but they do so without attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa des kyang rlom sems su byed pa de lta bu ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa des kyang rlom sems su byed pa de lta bu ni /
translated: And through that perfection of giving they become conceited.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i thabs mi mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i thabs mi mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, you should know that this is a bodhisattva great being’s lack of skill in means when practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral bas gzugs nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral bas gzugs nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of wisdom,🔽they attend to the idea that form is the inner emptiness,

original: gzugs phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: gzugs phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: they attend to the idea that form is the outer emptiness,

original: gzugs phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: gzugs phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They should pay attention to the fact that form is empty of an intrinsic nature.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is empty of an extrinsic nature.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is empty of an intrinsic and extrinsic nature.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is empty of emptiness.

original: gzugs dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: gzugs dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They should pay attention to the fact that form is not empty of form.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is not non-empty of form.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is not empty of non-form.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is not non-empty of non-form.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is not empty of an intrinsic nature.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is not non-empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa dang bral bas tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa dang bral bas tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed pa dang /
translated: They should pay attention to the fact that form is not empty of an extrinsic nature.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is not non-empty of an extrinsic nature.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is not empty of an intrinsic and extrinsic nature.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is not non-empty of an intrinsic and extrinsic nature.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is not empty of emptiness.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is not non-empty of emptiness.

original: rnam par shes pa phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa dang bral bas rnam par shes pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed cing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar de yang
analyzed: rnam par shes pa phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa dang bral bas rnam par shes pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed cing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar de yang
translated: They should pay attention to the fact that form is not empty of the absence of an intrinsic nature.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is not non-empty of the absence of an intrinsic nature.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is not empty of the absence of an extrinsic nature.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is not non-empty of the absence of an extrinsic nature.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is not empty of the absence of an intrinsic and extrinsic nature.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is not non-empty of the absence of an intrinsic and extrinsic nature.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is not empty of the emptiness of an intrinsic nature.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is not non-empty of the emptiness of an intrinsic nature.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is not empty of the emptiness of an extrinsic nature.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that form is not non-empty of the emptiness of an

original: dmigs te / dmigs pa'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid de dag gis kyang rlom sems su byed do //🔽mig nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: dmigs te / dmigs pa'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid de dag gis kyang rlom sems su byed do // mig nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: and they are conceited about those emptinesses because they apprehend them and view them as real.🔽They pay attention to the eyes as ‘empty of an inner self.’

original: mig phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /🔽mig phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: mig phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed / mig phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to the eyes as ‘empty of an outer self.’🔽They pay attention to the eyes as ‘empty of an inner and outer self.’

original: mig dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed cing stong pa nyid de yang dmigs te /
analyzed: mig dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed cing stong pa nyid de yang dmigs te /
translated: They pay attention to the eyes as ‘empty of an essential nature that is not nonexistent.’🔽They are conceited about those emptinesses because they apprehend them and view them as real.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid de dag gis kyang rlom sems su byed pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /🔽yid phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid de dag gis kyang rlom sems su byed pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed / yid phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to the ears, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind as ‘empty of an inner self.’🔽They pay attention to the ears, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind as ‘empty of an outer self.’

original: yid phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: yid phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to the ears, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind as ‘empty of an inner and outer self.’

original: yid dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed cing nang stong pa nyid de yang dmigs te /
analyzed: yid dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed cing nang stong pa nyid de yang dmigs te /
translated: They pay attention to the thought, ‘The mind is the emptiness that is the nature of the absence of an entity,’ and they apprehend inner emptiness.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid de dag gis kyang rlom sems su @171a * //🔽byed pa dang / gzugs nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid de dag gis kyang rlom sems su @171a * // byed pa dang / gzugs nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They are conceited about those kinds of emptiness because they apprehend them.🔽They pay attention to the thought, ‘Form is inner emptiness.’

original: gzugs phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: gzugs phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to the thought, ‘Form is outer emptiness.’

original: gzugs phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: gzugs phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to the thought, ‘Form is inner and outer emptiness.’

original: gzugs dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /🔽sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /🔽chos phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: gzugs dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed / chos phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to the thought, ‘Form is the emptiness that is the nature of the absence of an entity.’🔽They pay attention to the thought, ‘Sounds, smells, tastes, tangibles, and dharmas are inner emptiness.’🔽They pay attention to the thought, ‘Sounds, smells, tastes, tangibles, and dharmas are outer emptiness.’

original: chos phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: chos phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to the thought, ‘Sounds, smells, tastes, tangibles, and dharmas are inner and outer emptiness.’

original: chos dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed cing nang stong pa nyid de yang dmigs te /
analyzed: chos dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed cing nang stong pa nyid de yang dmigs te /
translated: They pay attention to ‘the emptiness of the nonexistence of things, up to the emptiness of essential nature,’ and they also apprehend inner emptiness.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid des kyang rlom sems su byed pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid des kyang rlom sems su byed pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They are conceited about that emptiness in terms of the way they apprehend it, and they pay attention to ‘eye consciousness is inner emptiness.’

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to ‘eye consciousness is outer emptiness.’

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to ‘eye consciousness is inner and outer emptiness.’

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to ‘eye consciousness is the emptiness of non-apprehension,’ up to ‘eye consciousness is the emptiness of essential nature that is not apprehended.’

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to ‘ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and thinking-mind consciousness is inner emptiness.’

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /🔽yid kyi rnam par shes pa phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed / yid kyi rnam par shes pa phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to the fact that mental consciousness is empty of the external,🔽they pay attention to the fact that mental consciousness is empty of the external and internal,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed cing nang stong pa nyid de yang dmigs te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed cing nang stong pa nyid de yang dmigs te /
translated: and they pay attention to the fact that mental consciousness is empty of the essence of non-entityness.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul tshul gyis stong pa nyid des kyang rlom sems su byed pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /🔽mig gi 'dus te reg pa phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul tshul gyis stong pa nyid des kyang rlom sems su byed pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed / mig gi 'dus te reg pa phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They are conceited about emptiness in the manner of observing something that is observed,🔽they pay attention to the fact that visual consciousness is empty of the external,

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa phyi nang stong pa zhes bya ba yid la byed /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa phyi nang stong pa zhes bya ba yid la byed /
translated: they pay attention to the fact that visual consciousness is empty of the external and internal,

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: and they pay attention to the fact that visual consciousness is empty of the essence of non-entityness.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /🔽yid kyi 'dus te @171b reg pa phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed / yid kyi 'dus te @171b reg pa phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They should pay attention to the fact that the composite of contact at the ear, the composite of contact at the nose, the composite of contact at the tongue, the composite of contact at the body, and the composite of contact at the mental faculty is inner emptiness.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that the composite of contact at the ear, the composite of contact at the nose, the composite of contact at the tongue, the composite of contact at the body, and the composite of contact at the mental faculty is outer emptiness.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /🔽yid kyi 'dus te reg pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed cing nang stong pa nyid de yang dmigs te /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed cing nang stong pa nyid de yang dmigs te /
translated: They should pay attention to the fact that the composite of contact at the ear, the composite of contact at the nose, the composite of contact at the tongue, the composite of contact at the body, and the composite of contact at the mental faculty is outer and inner emptiness.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that the composite of contact at the ear, the composite of contact at the nose, the composite of contact at the tongue, the composite of contact at the body, and the composite of contact at the mental faculty is the emptiness of emptiness, up to the fact that it is the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nang stong pa nyid des kyang rlom sems su byed pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i bar nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar dang /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nang stong pa nyid des kyang rlom sems su byed pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i bar nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar dang /
translated: They should pay attention to the fact that the eye consciousness, up to the mind consciousness, and similarly, the composite of contact at the eye, up to the composite of contact at the mind,

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They should pay attention to the fact that the feeling that arises from the condition of the convergence of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculties is inner emptiness.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They should pay attention to the fact that the feeling that arises from the condition of the convergence of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculties is outer emptiness.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They should pay attention to the fact that the feeling that arises from the condition of the convergence of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculties is outer and inner emptiness.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They should pay attention to the fact that the feeling that arises from the condition of the convergence of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculties is emptiness of emptiness, up to the fact that it is the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that the feeling that arises from the condition of the convergence of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculties is inner emptiness.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They should pay attention to the fact that the feeling that arises from the condition of the convergence of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculties is outer emptiness.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to the condition of eye contact as an inner emptiness,🔽they pay attention to the condition of eye contact as an outer emptiness,

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /🔽yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed cing nang stong pa nyid de yang dmigs te /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed cing nang stong pa nyid de yang dmigs te /
translated: they pay attention to the condition of eye contact as an outer and inner emptiness,🔽and they pay attention to the condition of eye contact as the emptiness of emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, and they apprehend inner emptiness.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid des kyang rlom sems su byed pa dang / sa'i khams nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid des kyang rlom sems su byed pa dang / sa'i khams nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to the earth element as an inner emptiness,

original: sa'i khams phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: sa'i khams phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: they pay attention to the earth element as an outer emptiness,

original: sa'i khams phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: sa'i khams phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed /
translated: they pay attention to the earth element as an outer and inner emptiness,

original: sa'i khams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: sa'i khams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: they pay attention to the earth element as the emptiness of emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, and they apprehend inner emptiness.

original: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams nang stong pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams nang stong pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed /
translated: the wind element as ‘the emptiness of emptiness,’🔽the space element as ‘the great emptiness,’

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams phyi stong pa nyid ces bya bar @172a * //🔽yid la byed /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams phyi stong pa nyid ces bya bar @172a * // yid la byed /
translated: and the consciousness element as ‘the emptiness of ultimate reality.’🔽They should pay attention to ignorance as ‘the inner emptiness,’🔽to the formative predispositions as ‘the outer emptiness,’🔽to consciousness as ‘the outer and inner emptiness,’

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed /
translated: to name and form as ‘the emptiness of emptiness,’🔽to the six sense fields as ‘the great emptiness,’🔽to contact as ‘the emptiness of ultimate reality,’

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /🔽ma rig pa nang stong pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed / ma rig pa nang stong pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed /
translated: to sensation as ‘the emptiness of conditioned phenomena,’🔽to craving as ‘the emptiness of the conditioned,’🔽to grasping as ‘the emptiness of the unconditioned,’🔽to becoming as ‘the emptiness of the unlimited,’

original: ma rig pa phyi stong pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed /🔽ma rig pa phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: ma rig pa phyi stong pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed / ma rig pa phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed /
translated: to birth as ‘the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end,’🔽to aging and death as ‘the emptiness of inherent existence,’🔽to suffering as ‘the emptiness of all things,’🔽to origination as ‘the emptiness of non-existent things,’🔽to cessation as ‘the emptiness of essential nature,’

original: ma rig pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: ma rig pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: and to the path as ‘the emptiness of inherent existence.’

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi nang stong pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi nang stong pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They should pay attention to the fact that conditioned states, consciousness, name and form, the six sense fields, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, and aging and death are the emptiness of internal phenomena,

original: rga shi phyi stong pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed /🔽rga shi phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: rga shi phyi stong pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed / rga shi phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed /
translated: and they should pay attention to the fact that aging and death are the emptiness of external phenomena.🔽They should pay attention to the fact that aging and death are the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena,

original: rga shi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed cing nang stong pa nyid de yang dmigs te /
analyzed: rga shi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya bar yid la byed cing nang stong pa nyid de yang dmigs te /
translated: and they should pay attention to the fact that aging and death are the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.🔽And they should apprehend the emptiness of internal phenomena,

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid des kyang rlom sems su byed do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid des kyang rlom sems su byed do //
translated: and through that emptiness they should become conceited.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral bas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams sgom zhing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral bas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams sgom zhing /
translated: They meditate on the applications of mindfulness while lacking the attention associated with omniscience.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa de dag kyang dmigs te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa de dag kyang dmigs te /
translated: They observe those applications of mindfulness.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa de dag gis kyang rlom sems su byed do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa de dag gis kyang rlom sems su byed do //
translated: And they are conceited about those applications of mindfulness through apprehending something.

original: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: Similarly, they meditate on the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, the path, the meditative stabilities, the immeasurable aspirations, and the formless absorptions.

original: mngon par shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams sgom par byed cing sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag kyang dmigs te /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams sgom par byed cing sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag kyang dmigs te /
translated: and they cultivate the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and they apprehend those buddhadharmas too.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag gis kyang rlom sems su byed do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag gis kyang rlom sems su byed do //
translated: And because of those buddhadharmas, they become conceited through apprehending something.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes @172b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes @172b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: de ltar thabs mi mkhas pas na /
analyzed: de ltar thabs mi mkhas pas na /
translated: are like that, unskilled in means,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos nas /
translated: when they hear this teaching of the perfection of wisdom

original: dngang zhing kun tu skrag la /
analyzed: dngang zhing kun tu skrag la /
translated: they will be frightened, will be terrified,

original: skrag pas zin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skrag pas zin par 'gyur ro //
translated: and will be gripped by fear.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das sdig pa'i grogs pos zin pa gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa thos nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sdig pa'i grogs pos zin pa gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa thos nas /
translated: “Lord, when those who are seized by bad friends hear this teaching of the perfection of wisdom

original: dngang zhing kun tu skrag la skrag pas zin par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: dngang zhing kun tu skrag la skrag pas zin par 'gyur ba /
translated: they will be frightened, terrified, and gripped by fear.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sdig pa'i grogs pos zin par ji ltar 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sdig pa'i grogs pos zin par ji ltar 'gyur ba lags /
translated: Blessed One, how do bodhisattva great beings come to be seized by evil companions?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs po ni gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar byed pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs po ni gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar byed pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: “Subhūti, here, a bodhisattva great being’s evil companion is someone who causes them to be separated from the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance,

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar byed pa ste /
translated: the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma yin /
translated: This was not taught by the Tathāgata.

original: 'di ni chos ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ni chos ma yin /
translated: This is not the Dharma.

original: 'di ni 'dul ba ma yin gyi /🔽'di la bslab par bya ba'i mi cha'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dul ba ma yin gyi /🔽'di la bslab par bya ba'i mi cha'o //
translated: This is not the Vinaya.🔽You should not train in this.”

original: mdo sde 'di dag ni rang bzor byas pa ste /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di dag ni rang bzor byas pa ste /
translated: “These sūtras are fabrications.

original: 'di dag ni mnyan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mnyan par mi bya'o //
translated: They are not to be listened to.

original: gzung bar mi bya'o //🔽bcang bar mi bya'o //🔽klag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzung bar mi bya'o // bcang bar mi bya'o // klag par mi bya'o //
translated: They are not to be taken up.🔽They are not to be borne in mind.🔽They are not to be recited.

original: kun chub par mi bya'o //
analyzed: kun chub par mi bya'o //
translated: They are not to be mastered.

original: tshul bzhin du yid la mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la mi bya'o //
translated: They are not to be properly paid attention to.

original: 'di dag ni gzhan la bstan par mi bya'o zhes zer ba 'di ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni gzhan la bstan par mi bya'o zhes zer ba 'di ni /
translated: They are not to be taught to others.”

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs por rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, you should know that this is a bodhisattva great being’s evil companion.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs po ni 'di ltar bdud sdig to can sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du byas pa dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du 'ongs nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs po ni 'di ltar bdud sdig to can sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du byas pa dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du 'ongs nas /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being’s evil companion is when Māra the wicked one, having taken on the appearance of a buddha, comes to a bodhisattva great being

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug las bzlog cing mos pa med par byed de /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug las bzlog cing mos pa med par byed de /
translated: and dissuades him from the six perfections, causing him to lose interest.

original: rigs kyi bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas khyod la ci zhig bya /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas khyod la ci zhig bya /
translated: ‘Son of a good family, what is the point of cultivating the perfection of wisdom?

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas khyod la ci zhig bya /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas khyod la ci zhig bya /
translated: What will you do by cultivating the perfection of meditative stabilization?

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas khyod la ci zhig bya /🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas @173a * //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas khyod la ci zhig bya / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas @173a * //
translated: What will you do by cultivating the perfection of perseverance?

original: khyod la ci zhig bya /
analyzed: khyod la ci zhig bya /
translated: What will you do by cultivating the perfection of patience?

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas khyod la ci zhig bya /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas khyod la ci zhig bya /
translated: What will you do by cultivating the perfection of morality?🔽What will you do by cultivating the perfection of giving?”

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas khyod la ci zhig bya zhes zer ba 'ong ngo zhes bdud kyi las mi ston /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas khyod la ci zhig bya zhes zer ba 'ong ngo zhes bdud kyi las mi ston /
translated: This is not teaching the work of Māra,

original: bdud kyi nyes pa mi ston pa 'di ni /
analyzed: bdud kyi nyes pa mi ston pa 'di ni /
translated: this is not teaching the faults of Māra.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs por rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, you should know that this is a bad friend of bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang bdud sdig can dag sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du byas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du phyin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang bdud sdig can dag sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du byas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du phyin te /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, Māra the wicked one, having transformed into the appearance of a buddha, comes into the presence of bodhisattva great beings and says,

original: nyan thos dang ldan pa'i mdo dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung du bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / 'di ltar 'das pa dang / skyes pa'i rabs dang / shin tu rgyas pa dang /
analyzed: nyan thos dang ldan pa'i mdo dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung du bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / 'di ltar 'das pa dang / skyes pa'i rabs dang / shin tu rgyas pa dang /
translated: He does not teach the sūtras, the geya, the vyākaraṇa, the gāthā, the udāna, the itivṛttaka, the jātaka, the vaipulya,

original: chos rmad du byung ba dang / rtog pa brjod pa dang / gtan la phab par bstan pa dag ston te /🔽'grel to // rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: chos rmad du byung ba dang / rtog pa brjod pa dang / gtan la phab par bstan pa dag ston te / 'grel to // rnam par 'byed do //
translated: the adbhutadharma, the avadāna, or the upadeśa that are associated with the pratyekabuddhas.

original: gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: gsal bar byed do //
translated: He does not teach the sūtras, the geya, the vyākaraṇa, the gāthā, the udāna, the itivṛttaka, the jātaka, the vaipulya,🔽the adbhutadharma, the avadāna, or the upadeśa that are associated with the bodhisattvas.🔽He does not teach the sūtras, the geya, the vyākaraṇa, the gāthā, the udāna, the itivṛttaka, the jātaka, the vaipulya,🔽the adbhutadharma, the avadāna, or the upadeśa that are associated with the tathāgatas.

original: yongs su ston to zhes bdud kyi las rnam pa 'di lta bu dag mi smra mi ston pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su ston to zhes bdud kyi las rnam pa 'di lta bu dag mi smra mi ston pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs por rig par bya'o //
translated: He does not teach the sūtras, the geya, the vyākaraṇa, the gāthā, the udāna, the itivṛttaka, the jātaka, the vaipulya,

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang bdud sdig can dag sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du byas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang bdud sdig can dag sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du byas shing /
translated: the adbhutadharma, the avadāna, or the upadeśa that are associated with the śrāvakas, the pratyekabuddhas, or the bodhisattvas.🔽He does not teach the sūtras, the geya, the vyākaraṇa, the gāthā, the udāna, the itivṛttaka, the jātaka, the vaipulya,🔽the adbhutadharma, the avadāna, or the upadeśa that are associated with the tathāgatas.🔽He does not teach the sūtras, the geya, the vyākaraṇa, the gāthā, the udāna, the itivṛttaka, the jātaka, the vaipulya,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du phyin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du phyin te /
translated: the adbhu

original: 'di skad du rigs kyi bu khyod la ni byang chub kyi sems cung zad kyang med /
analyzed: 'di skad du rigs kyi bu khyod la ni byang chub kyi sems cung zad kyang med /
translated: He does not say or show such things as: ‘Son of a good family, you do not have even a little of the thought of awakening.

original: khyod ni phyir mi ldog pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: khyod ni phyir mi ldog pa yang ma yin /
translated: You are not irreversible.

original: khyod kyis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar yang mi nus so zhes zer ba ni 'di lta bu'i bdud kyi las dag mi smra mi ston pa 'di ni /
analyzed: khyod kyis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar yang mi nus so zhes zer ba ni 'di lta bu'i bdud kyi las dag mi smra mi ston pa 'di ni /
translated: You are not able to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs por rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, you should know that this is a bodhisattva great being’s wicked friend.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang bdud sdig can dag sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du byas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang bdud sdig can dag sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du byas shing /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, wicked Māras, having taken on the appearance of buddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i drung du phyin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i drung du phyin te /
translated: approach a bodhisattva great being and say,

original: 'di skad du rigs kyi bu mig ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
analyzed: 'di skad du rigs kyi bu mig ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
translated: ‘Son of a good family, the eye is empty of a self or what belongs to a self.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
translated: The ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind are empty of a self or what belongs to a self.

original: gzugs ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
translated: Form is empty of a self or what belongs to a self.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg @173b dang / chos ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg @173b dang / chos ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
translated: Sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental phenomena are empty of a self or what belongs to a self.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
translated: Eye consciousness is empty of a self or what belongs to a self.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
translated: Ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and thinking-mind consciousness are empty of a self or what belongs to a self.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
translated: Eye contact is empty of a self or what belongs to a self.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
translated: Ear contact, nose contact, tongue contact, body contact, and thinking-mind contact are empty of a self or what belongs to a self.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
translated: Feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact is empty of a self or what belongs to a self.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
translated: the feeling that arises from the condition of ear-contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of nose-contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of tongue-contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of body-contact, and the feeling that arises from the condition of mind-contact are empty of self or what belongs to self.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
translated: The perfection of giving is empty of self or what belongs to self.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
translated: The perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are empty of self or what belongs to self.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni bdag gam bdag gis stong ngo //
translated: The applications of mindfulness are empty of self or what belongs to self.

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar ni bdag gam bdag gis stong na /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar ni bdag gam bdag gis stong na /
translated: the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, the path, up to the distinct attributes of a buddha are empty of self and of what belongs to a self,🔽what is the point of fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?’

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te yang ci zhig bya zhes zer ba de lta bu'i bdud kyi las dag mi smra mi ston pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs🔽por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te yang ci zhig bya zhes zer ba de lta bu'i bdud kyi las dag mi smra mi ston pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs por rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, when Māra the wicked one does not speak or show such deeds of Māra, you should know that he is a bodhisattva great being’s wicked companion.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang bdud sdig can dag rang sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du byas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang bdud sdig can dag rang sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du byas shing /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, Māra the wicked one, having made himself into the form of a pratyekabuddha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du phyin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du phyin te /
translated: approaches a bodhisattva great being

original: 'di skad du rigs kyi bu shar phyogs ni sangs rgyas bcom @174a * //
analyzed: 'di skad du rigs kyi bu shar phyogs ni sangs rgyas bcom @174a * //
translated: and says, ‘Son of a good family, in the east there are no buddhas,

original: ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos rnams kyis stong ste /
analyzed: ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos rnams kyis stong ste /
translated: The Blessed One, the bodhisattvas, and the śrāvakas are empty.

original: 'di la ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba yang med do //
analyzed: 'di la ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba yang med do //
translated: Here there is no such thing as a buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba yang med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba yang med do //
translated: There is no such thing as a bodhisattva.

original: nyan thos zhes bya ba yang med do //
analyzed: nyan thos zhes bya ba yang med do //
translated: There is no such thing as a śrāvaka.

original: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs bcu kun kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos rnams kyis stong ste /
analyzed: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs bcu kun kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos rnams kyis stong ste /
translated: The ten directions—south, west, north, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, below, and above—are empty of the blessed buddhas, the bodhisattvas, and the śrāvakas.

original: 'di la ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba yang med do //
analyzed: 'di la ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba yang med do //
translated: Here there is no such thing as a buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba yang med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba yang med do //
translated: There is no such thing as a bodhisattva.

original: nyan thos zhes bya ba yang med do zhes zer ba de lta bu'i bdud kyi las dag mi smra mi ston pa 'di ni /
analyzed: nyan thos zhes bya ba yang med do zhes zer ba de lta bu'i bdud kyi las dag mi smra mi ston pa 'di ni /
translated: There is no such thing as a śrāvaka.”🔽“

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs por rig par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor gzhan yang bdud sdig can dag nyan thos kyi cha byad du byas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du phyin te /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba las bzlog cing nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa de lta bu'i bdud kyi las dag mi smra mi ston pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs por rig par bya'o // rab 'byor gzhan yang bdud sdig can dag nyan thos kyi cha byad du byas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du phyin te / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba las bzlog cing nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa de lta bu'i bdud kyi las dag mi smra mi ston pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs por rig par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, you should know that a bodhisattva great being’s bad friend is a bodhisattva great being who, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of wisdom, does not explain to them and does not teach them the dharmas that are obstacles to the knowledge of all aspects, and who does not explain to them and does not teach them the dharmas that are not obstacles to the knowledge of all aspects.🔽“Subhūti, you should know that a bodhisattva great being’s bad friend is a bodhisattva great being who, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of wisdom, does not explain to them and does not teach them the dharmas that are obstacles to the knowledge of all aspects, and who does not explain to them and does not teach them the dharmas that are not obstacles to the knowledge of all aspects.🔽“Subhūti, you should know that a bodhisattva great being’s bad friend is a bodhisattva great being who, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of wisdom, does not explain to them and does not teach them the dharmas that are obstacles to the knowledge of all aspects, and who does not explain to them and does not teach them the dharmas that are not obstacles to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang bdud sdig can dag mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi cha byad du byas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du phyin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang bdud sdig can dag mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi cha byad du byas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du phyin te /
translated: “Subhūti, you should know that a bodhisattva great being’s bad friend is a bodhisattva great being who, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of wisdom, does not explain to them and does not teach them the dharmas that are obstacles to the knowledge of all aspects, and who does not explain to them and does not teach them the dharmas that are not obstacles to the knowledge of all aspects.🔽“Subhūti, you should know that a bodhisattva great being’s bad friend is a bodhisattva great being who, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of wisdom, does not explain to them and does not teach them the dharmas that are obstacles to the knowledge of all aspects, and who does not explain to them and does not teach them the dharmas that are not obstacles to the knowledge of all aspects.🔽“Subhūti, you should know that a bodhisattva great being’s bad friend is a bodhisattva great being who, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of wisdom, does not explain to them and does not teach them the dharmas that are obstacles to

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa las bzlog cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba las bzlog ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa las bzlog cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba las bzlog ste /
translated: They turn them away from the bodhisattva deeds and from the attention associated with knowing the aspects of the path,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la sbyor ba dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la sbyor ba dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la sbyor ba dang /
translated: and they get them to apply themselves to the applications of mindfulness, to the right efforts, to the bases of miracle powers, to the faculties, to the powers, to the branches of enlightenment, and to the noble eightfold path.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i bar gyi chos rnams la sbyor zhing /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i bar gyi chos rnams la sbyor zhing /
translated: They get them to apply themselves to the dharmas from emptiness up to the wishless.

original: de ltar rigs kyi bu khyod kyis chos de dag yongs su bsgoms la nyan thos kyi sa mngon du byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par @174b rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyis khyod la ci zhig bya zhes zer ba de lta bu'i bdud kyi las dag mi
analyzed: de ltar rigs kyi bu khyod kyis chos de dag yongs su bsgoms la nyan thos kyi sa mngon du byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par @174b rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyis khyod la ci zhig bya zhes zer ba de lta bu'i bdud kyi las dag mi
translated: And they say, ‘Son of a good family, you should cultivate those dharmas like that, and then actualize the śrāvaka level. What will you do with unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?’

original: smra mi ston pa 'di ni /
analyzed: smra mi ston pa 'di ni /
translated: This is not taught for those who speak.🔽

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs por rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the kind of person who should be known as a bodhisattva great being’s evil companion.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang bdud sdig can dag pha dang ma'i cha byad du byas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang bdud sdig can dag pha dang ma'i cha byad du byas shing /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, Māra the wicked one, having taken on the appearance of one’s father and mother,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du phyin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du phyin te /
translated: approaches a bodhisattva great being and says,

original: 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas khyod la ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas khyod la ci zhig bya /
translated: ‘You have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening. What will you do with this?

original: de'i don du ni bskal pa tshad med grangs med par 'khor ba na 'khor zhing /
analyzed: de'i don du ni bskal pa tshad med grangs med par 'khor ba na 'khor zhing /
translated: For its sake you will wander in cyclic existence for countless, immeasurable eons,

original: rkang lag dang mgo bcad pa tshad med pas nyon mongs par 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: rkang lag dang mgo bcad pa tshad med pas nyon mongs par 'gyur gyis /
translated: and you will be afflicted by having countless hands, feet, and heads cut off.’

original: gang la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byar yod pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du byar yod pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du byar yod pa dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byar yod pa de la brtson par gyis shig ces zer ba de lta bu'i bdud kyi las dag mi smra mi ston pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs por rig par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor gzhan yang bdud sdig can dag dge slong gi cha byad du byas shing /
analyzed: gang la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byar yod pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du byar yod pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du byar yod pa dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byar yod pa de la brtson par gyis shig ces zer ba de lta bu'i bdud kyi las dag mi smra mi ston pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sdig pa'i grogs por rig par bya'o // rab 'byor gzhan yang bdud sdig can dag dge slong gi cha byad du byas shing /
translated: “You should make an effort in the fruit of entering the stream, in the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, in the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and in the fruit of arhatship.”🔽Subhūti, you should know that Māra the wicked one, having approached a bodhisattva great being in the guise of a monk,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du phyin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du phyin te /
translated: says this:🔽“You should make an effort in the fruit of entering the stream, in the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, in the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and in the fruit of arhatship.”

original: gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ston pa dang / gzugs sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / snon pa med pa zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ston pa dang /🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ston pa dang / rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ston pa dang / gzugs sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / snon pa med pa zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ston pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ston pa dang / rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang /
translated: “Form is impermanent,” and so on, and “Form is suffering, without a self, calm, void, empty, signless, and wishless,”🔽“Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are impermanent,” and so on, and “Consciousness is suffering, without a self, calm, void, empty, signless, and wishless,”

original: stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ston pa dang / mig mi rtag ces bya ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang /
analyzed: stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ston pa dang / mig mi rtag ces bya ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang /
translated: “The eyes are impermanent,” and so on, and “The eyes are suffering, without a self, calm, void, empty, signless, and wishless,”

original: stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ston pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus @175a * //🔽dang ; yid mi rtag ces bya ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ston pa dang /

translated: “It is to teach by way of apprehending ‘the eyes are empty,’ ‘the eyes are signless,’ and ‘the eyes are without aspirations.’🔽“It is to teach by way of apprehending ‘the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are impermanent,’ ‘the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are suffering,’ ‘the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are selfless,’ ‘the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are calm,’ ‘the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are void,’ ‘the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are afflicted,’ ‘the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are purified,’ ‘the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are empty,’ ‘the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are signless,’ and ‘the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are without aspirations.’🔽“It is to teach by way of apprehending ‘form is impermanent,’ ‘form is suffering,’ ‘form is selfless,’ ‘form is calm,’ ‘form is void,’ ‘form is afflicted,’ ‘form is purified,’ ‘form is empty,’ ‘form is signless,’ and ‘form is without aspirations.’
